hypothesis_content.title: BTC-ETH Pairs Mean Reversion on 5-Day Z-Score Threshold
hypothesis_content.statement: When the 5-day rolling z-score of the BTC/ETH price ratio exceeds ±2.0 standard deviations from its 30-day mean during NEUTRAL regimes, a pairs trade (long underperformer/short outperformer) will generate positive returns with a Sharpe ratio >1.5 over the subsequent 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BTC and ETH maintain strong long-term correlation (0.85+) but experience temporary divergences during neutral markets where neither trend dominates. The 5-day z-score captures short-term dislocations while the 30-day mean provides stable equilibrium. Neutral regimes reduce directional risk.
entry_conditions: BTC/ETH 5-day z-score > +2.0: Short BTC, Long ETH (equal dollar amounts)
BTC/ETH 5-day z-score < -2.0: Long BTC, Short ETH (equal dollar amounts)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Z-score crosses back to ±0.5 standard deviations

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of trades hit stop-loss before take-profit, or Sharpe ratio < 0.8 over 100+ trades.
